result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jesse Glen Skytland

records.addlTxt:
1:02 PM Defendant Jesse Glen Skytland in court.  Attorney Peter Michael Masana in court for Jesse Glen Skytland.  Prosecuting attorney Rick C Spoentgen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Masana states matters are not yet resolved.  Requests prelim in 22CF534 and asks that 22CM345 track for plea hearing.  Bond continued.
Plea hearing scheduled for December 15, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Plea hearing on December 15, 2022 at 09:45 am.

2:14 pm  Defendant Jesse Glen Skytland appears by phone.  Court states case and appearances.  Court questions DE on his petition.  DE is in disability and that means his income is high enough that he doesn't qualify for PD appt.  SSDI is his only income.  Court finds DE conditionally indigent and appoints Atty Peter Masana (608) 448-4109.  To reimburse COC's office $25/month beginning on or before 9/15/222 and then by the 15th of each month thereafter.

Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  Advised rights to an attorney.  File set for pre-trial conference/return date.  DE confirms the address on file is where he can receive mail.  Bond continues.  Special bond conditions as follows: No violent or abusive contact with S.LC.
